strapiPost.title: ArDOT Receiving Feedback On Proposed Highway 112 Project
strapiPost.content:
Arkansas Department of Transportation is hosting two in-person meetings this week, today, Dec 13, and Thursday, Dec 15, to share plans and receive feedback for a proposed $193.2m project to widen Arkansas Highway 112.

  • Up the corridor: The proposed plan would widen Highway 112 to four lanes with a median, bike path, and sidewalk stretching from Highway 12 in Bentonville to Highway 412 in Tontitown.
  • Meet up: The meeting today will be hosted from 4-7p at Elm Springs United Methodist Church, focusing on the segment between Highway 412 and 612; then, Thursday's meeting from 4-7p will take place at the Bentonville Community Center, addressing the segment between Highway 612 and 12.

Learn more about this project HERE,
